Class GameTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • GameTimer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameTimer
extends java.lang.Thread
    This is the GameTimer class that controls the running and display of the timer used in the game. It is a countdown timer.
    Version:
    1.0 05.24.2015
    Author:
    Zachary Teper (0 hours) and Angela Zhu (1 hour)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int timeRemaining
      The int variable timeRemaining stores the time (in seconds) that the user has left to complete the game.

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        MAX_PRIORITY, MIN_PRIORITY, NORM_PRIORITY

    • Field Detail

      • timeRemaining

        public static int timeRemaining
        The int variable timeRemaining stores the time (in seconds) that the user has left to complete the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameTimer

        public GameTimer(int difficulty,
                 javax.swing.JLabel label,
                 GamePanel panel,
                 ScarletGemMain game)
        This is the contructor for the class GameTimer.
        Parameters:
        difficulty, - int
        label, - JLabel
        panel, - GamePanel
        game, - ScarletGemMain local variables

        difficulty the int variable used to store the difficulty of the game.

        label an instance of the JLabel class used to display the timer.

        panel an instance of the GamePanel class, used to display the label.

        game an instance of the ScarletGemMain class, used to control methods in the class.

        Conditional Statements

        If Structure #1:

        If the difficulty is 0 (easy), set the startingTime to 60.

        Or if the difficulty is 1 (medium), set the startingTime to 90.

        If it's neither of the above, set the startingTime to 120.

        public boolean getGameWon()
        Returns true only if the game has been completed.
        Returns:
        boolean true only if game has been completed.

      • timer

        public void timer()
        Starts counting down from the starting time. Regularly updates the Timer JLabel on the game panel. While loops
        • continuously decrements the game timer.
        If statements
        • checks if game is paused.
        • checks if the timer is at zero.
        • checks if the game has been won.

      • minutes

        public int minutes()
        Returns the number of minutes left in the game.
        Returns:
        int the number of minutes left in the game.

      • seconds

        public java.lang.String seconds()
        Returns a String representation of the number of seconds left in the game (not including minutes).
        Returns:
        String the number of seconds left in the game (not including minutes).

      • run

        Calls the timer() method to start the timer
